metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: A method is a block of code which only runs when it is called.
content.html: A method is a block of code which only runs when it is called.

content.text: You can pass data, known as parameters, into a method.
content.html: You can pass data, known as parameters, into a method.

content.text: Methods are used to perform certain actions, and they are also known as functions .
content.html: Methods are used to perform certain actions, and they are also known as functions.

content.text: Why use methods? To reuse code: define the code once, and use it many times.
content.html: Why use methods? To reuse code: define the code once, and use it many times.

content.text: A method must be declared within a class. It is defined with the name of the method, followed by parentheses () . Java provides some pre-defined methods, such as System.out.println() , but you can also create your own methods to perform certain actions:
content.html: A method must be declared within a class. It is defined with the name of the method, followed by parentheses (). Java provides some pre-defined methods, such as System.out.println(), but you can also create your own methods to perform certain actions:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  static void myMethod() {
    // code to be executed
  }
}

content.text: To call a method in Java, write the method's name followed by two parentheses () and a semicolon ;
content.html: To call a method in Java, write the method's name followed by two parentheses () and a semicolon;

content.text: In the following example, myMethod() is used to print a text (the action), when it is called:
content.html: In the following example, myMethod() is used to print a text (the action), when it is called:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  static void myMethod() {
    System.out.println("I just got executed!");
  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    myMethod();
  }
}

// Outputs "I just got executed!"

content.text: A method can also be called multiple times:
content.html: A method can also be called multiple times:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  static void myMethod() {
    System.out.println("I just got executed!");
  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    myMethod();
    myMethod();
    myMethod();
  }
}

// I just got executed!
// I just got executed!
// I just got executed!

content.text: In the next chapter, Method Parameters , you will learn how to pass data (parameters) into a method.
content.html: In the next chapter, Method Parameters, you will learn how to pass data (parameters) into a method.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
How can you call a method in Java?
content.html: How can you call a method in Java?

metadata.question: How can you call a method in Java?

options.text: By using a special variable called method, followed by a semicolon
By using the name of the method followed by two parantheses and a semicolon
By using the call keyword and the name of the method and a semicolon

content.question: How can you call a method in Java?

options.text: By using a special variable called method, followed by a semicolon
By using the name of the method followed by two parantheses and a semicolon
By using the call keyword and the name of the method and a semicolon
